qas.question: What are organic plants understood to be?
Without what are organic plants meant to be grown ?
What is meant by synthetic chemicals?
What group in the US determines the allowed practices in organic agriculture?
How much organic cotton was produced worldwide in 2007?
What are NOP plants understood to be?
Without what are NOP plants meant to be grown?
What is meant by NOP chemicals?
What group in the US determines the allowed practices in 24 countries?
How much sythetic cotton was produced worldwide in 2007?

context: Organic cotton is generally understood as cotton from plants <a0_0><b5_0>not genetically modified<b5_0/><a0_0/> and that is certified to be grown without the use of any <a1_0><b6_0>synthetic agricultural chemicals<b6_0/><a1_0/>, such as <a2_0><b7_0>fertilizers or pesticides<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Its production also promotes and enhances biodiversity and biological cycles. In the United States, organic cotton plantations are required to enforce the <a3_0><b8_0>National Organic Program<b8_0/><a3_0/> (NOP). This institution determines the allowed practices for pest control, growing, fertilizing, and handling of organic crops. As of 2007, <a4_0><b9_0>265,517 bales<b9_0/><a4_0/> of organic cotton were produced in 24 countries, and worldwide production was growing at a rate of more than 50% per year.
